✅ 1. Understand the Dataset
Viewing the first few rows
Checking the size of the dataset
Getting a basic idea of columns
Describing the dataset

✅ 2. Check for Missing Values
Finding missing/null values
Identifying which columns need fixing
Deciding whether to drop or fill missing data

✅ 3. Check Data Types
Identifying numerical vs categorical columns
Fixing incorrect data types
Converting columns (e.g., strings → integers, dates → datetime)

✅ 4. Remove Duplicates
Detecting duplicate rows
Removing duplicates
Ensuring dataset integrity

✅ 5. Univariate Analysis (Single Column Analysis)
Distribution of numerical columns
Frequency of categorical columns
Summary statistics
Histograms, count plots, boxplots

✅ 6. Bivariate Analysis (Two Columns Analysis)
Relationship between two variables
Categorical vs numerical relationships
Scatter plots, bar charts, boxplots
Finding correlations

✅ 7. Outlier Detection
Spotting extreme values
Understanding outliers using boxplots
Removing or treating outliers
Using IQR or Z-score methods

✅ 8. Feature Engineering
Creating new columns from existing data
Encoding categorical variables
Grouping or binning values
Extracting useful information

✅ 9. Understanding Relationships & Patterns
Distribution
Trends
Patterns
Unique values
Frequency tables

✅ 10. Visualization Summary
Heatmaps
Pairplots
Correlation matrices
Summary charts to understand insights clearly
